p: Postviral syndromes manifest as low energy levels, low mood, and dizziness; these have been shown to be associated with postviral hypocortisolism and are dramatically improved with cortisol replacement [ 41]. Furthermore, insertion/deletion polymorphisms in the ACE gene coding for ACE receptors are associated with an increased risk of idiopathic chronic fatigue and chronic fatigue syndrome [ 42]. These effects have been suggested to be mediated by ACE receptors interacting with neurotransmitter pathways [ 41]. Because ACE2 is expressed in the hypothalamus and could be disrupted by the SARS-CoV-2 infection, it may play a role in postviral fatigue and associated hypocortisolism [ 43, 44].
